weird 0.0.0.9000

weird

Overview

The weird package contains functions and data used in the book *That’s Weird: Anomaly Detection Using R by Rob J Hyndman. It also loads several packages needed to do the analysis described in the book. These packages work with the tidyverse set of packages, sharing common data representations and API design.

Installation

You can install the development version of weird from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("robjhyndman/weird-package")

Usage

library(weird) will load the following packages:

  • dplyr, for data manipulation.
  • ggplot2, for data visualisation.
  • ks, for fitting models and producing forecasts.

You also get a condensed summary of conflicts with other packages you have loaded:

library(weird)
#> ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── weird 0.0.0.9000 ──
#> ✔ dplyr   1.1.4      ✔ ks      1.14.1
#> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.4
#> ── Conflicts ──────────────────────────────────────────────── weird_conflicts ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
